node.Title: New OpenSSL critical vulnerability: What you need to know
node.Description: An upcoming release of OpenSSL, scheduled for November 1, 2022, addresses a critical security vulnerability. This post explains how to detect the vulnerability in your code and describes mitigation steps.

node.Title: How to personalize search experiences using Elastic
What is your stickiness metric really saying?
node.Description:
Stickiness is an extremely popular engagement metric. It’s used by product managers to make roadmap decisions, and it’s cherished by investors for its help in determining investment worthiness. It’s also one of the most misleading metrics there is if you don’t know exactly how it works. In this article, we’ll dive into concrete examples of

The post What is your stickiness metric really saying? appeared first on Mixpanel.

node.Title: How to write your first unit test in JavaScript
node.Description: Testing code is the first step to making it secure. One of the best ways to do this is to use unit tests, ensuring that each of the smaller functions within an app behave as they should — especially when the app receives edge-case or invalid inputs, or inputs that are potentially harmful.

node.Title: Career stories: Four engineering careers. One LinkedIn.

Based in Silicon Valley, this mom of three walks us through her impactful career journey from our LinkedIn consumer and data teams, then to working on the LinkedIn Sales Solutions team, to now working for LinkedIn Talent Solutions. Before joining LinkedIn, I worked my way up in Silicon Valley’s consumer software engineering space as a backend (apps) engineer. node.Title: On Time and Under Budget: 3 Project Management Tips
node.Description:
Every project has its unique challenges, but staying on budget is common to almost all of them. Keeping track of every penny while maximizing resources can be difficult—in fact, a Project Management Institute study found that 11.4% of investment is lost due to poor project performance. However, if your entire team has an open view of schedules, tasks, and available resources, it’s much easier to devise a cohesive strategy that

Continue reading...

node.Title: Privacy Gateway: a privacy preserving proxy built on Internet standards
node.Description: Privacy Gateway enables privacy-forward applications to use Cloudflare as a trusted Relay, limiting which identifying information, including IP addresses, is visible to their infrastructure

node.Title: Stronger than a promise: proving Oblivious HTTP privacy properties
node.Description: In this blog post, we describe a formal, computer-aided security analysis of Oblivious HTTP, an emerging IETF standard that applications can use to improve user privacy

node.Title: Using Apache Solr REST API in CDP Public Cloud
node.Description:
In this blog post we describe how to use the REST API of Apache Solr in CDP Public Cloud directly or through Apache Knox Gateway. We show indicative performance measurements, demonstrating the performance improvement one can achieve by reusing cookies set by the Knox Gateway.

The post Using Apache Solr REST API in CDP Public Cloud appeared first on Cloudera Blog.
